intro: Cremastosperma novogranatense, commonly known as the Brazilian burr vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain hard, seed-like structures. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Due to its rapid growth and invasive tendencies, it is considered a weed in some areas.
